title: Distance formula
speech: The distance formula is  the square root of parentheses, x sub 2 minus x sub 1,  squared plus, parentheses, y sub 2 minus y sub 1,  squared end root .
pacedSpeech: The distance formula is   the square root of , x sub 2 minus x sub 1,  squared plus, , y sub 2 minus y sub 1,  squared end root

title: Plug in
text: Plug in the values for the equation. Choose a point to be the $$x_2$$ and $$y_2$$ pair, and use the other as the $$x_1$$ and $$y_1$$ pair. We get $$\sqrt{{\left(7-\left(-8\right)\right)}^2+{\left(6-\left(-2\right)\right)}^2}=\sqrt{289}$$.
speech: Plug in the values for the equation. Choose a point to be the  x sub 2  and  y sub 2  pair, and use the other as the  x sub 1  and  y sub 1  pair. We get  the square root of parentheses, 7 minus negative 8,  squared plus, parentheses, 6 minus negative 2,  squared end root is equal to, the square root of 289 .

title: Simplify
text: Simplify the answer into one term. $$\sqrt{289}=17$$
speech: Simplify the answer into one term. , the square root of 289 is equal to 17
